params.chat_instruct_command:
Continue the chat dialogue below. Write a single reply for the character "<|character|>".

<|prompt|>
params.user_input:
Based on your responce. What is the preference between the two colleges?
You MUST respond ```A is preferred over B``` if college A is preferred over college B.
You MUST respond ```B is preferred over A``` if college B is preferred over college A.
You MUST respond ```Equal preference``` if colleges A and B are equally preferred.

internal:
College A: ```Washington University in St. Louis```
College B: ```Bowdoin College```
Comment: ```@reindeercoffee what country do you currently live in?  Maine and Missouri are definitely different.  ```
Is there a preference between the two colleges in the comment?
You MUST respond ```No preference``` if there is no explicit preference in the comment.
You MUST respond ```Has preference``` if there is explicit preference in the comment.

College A: ```University of Michigan```
College B: ```Massachusetts Institute of Technology```
Comment: ```Another vote here for Michigan.  Great school and you’re getting the deal of the century cost-wise.  ```
Is there a preference between the two colleges in the comment?
You MUST respond ```No preference``` if there is no explicit preference in the comment.
You MUST respond ```Has preference``` if there is explicit preference in the comment.

Based on your responce. What is the preference between the two colleges?
You MUST respond ```A is preferred over B``` if college A is preferred over college B.
You MUST respond ```B is preferred over A``` if college B is preferred over college A.
You MUST respond ```Equal preference``` if colleges A and B are equally preferred.

College A: ```University of Richmond```
College B: ```Haverford College```
Comment: ```It sounds like you want Haverford. Maybe you should go with your gut as they are both great schools.  ```
Is there a preference between the two colleges in the comment?
You MUST respond ```No preference``` if there is no explicit preference in the comment.
You MUST respond ```Has preference``` if there is explicit preference in the comment.

Based on your responce. What is the preference between the two colleges?
You MUST respond ```A is preferred over B``` if college A is preferred over college B.
You MUST respond ```B is preferred over A``` if college B is preferred over college A.
You MUST respond ```Equal preference``` if colleges A and B are equally preferred.

College A: ```Pomona College```
College B: ```Johns Hopkins University```
Comment: ```I don’t see any “wrong” choice here, not do I see any “perfect” choice.  Pick one and don’t look back.  ```
Is there a preference between the two colleges in the comment?
You MUST respond ```No preference``` if there is no explicit preference in the comment.
You MUST respond ```Has preference``` if there is explicit preference in the comment.

Based on your responce. What is the preference between the two colleges?
You MUST respond ```A is preferred over B``` if college A is preferred over college B.
You MUST respond ```B is preferred over A``` if college B is preferred over college A.
You MUST respond ```Equal preference``` if colleges A and B are equally preferred.

College A: ```Columbia University```
College B: ```University of Michigan```
Comment: ```“Except Michigan has ~ 45,000 students of which 28000 are undergrads, compared to 31000 at Columbia of which 6000 are undergrads. This isn’t even close, I simply not convincing you af anything even though the facts bear it out. There is no comparison at the undergrad level.” The 6,000 undergraduate students (I am fairly certain it is closer to 8,000 when you include General Studies) still have to share the faculty and resources with those 23,000 graduate students. At any university, undergraduate students do not exist in a vacuum. I don’t see how there’s any difference CU123. Columbia has limited resources, and 31,000 students to look after. Your facts are not convincing at all. A university’s endowment is shared by all of its students, graduate and undergraduate, not just by the undergraduate students. Same with a university’s faculty. If anything, I have provided more facts. Where are the placement figures for Columbia that show that Columbia places more graduates in Silicon Valley? I have shown how many Michigan graduates are placed in major tech firms, and I even provided comparative data from Penn. Sadly, Columbia does not publish such data. Where are the peer ratings that prove that Columbia is a far superior university to Michigan? According to the US News Peer Assessment score, Columbia’s rating hovers between 4.6 and 4.7, while Michigan’s hovers between 4.4 and 4.5. That makes them peers in the eyes of university presidents, deans of undergraduate colleges and provosts. And how do you prove that Columbia has a 6:1 student to faculty ratio when Fu has a 25:1 ratio and the 4,500 College students share their faculty with 3,500 Graduate School of the Arts and Sciences? Those are the facts I want addressed…and they are facts. I am still waiting for the evidence to support your claim that Columbia is a vastly superior university to Michigan to the extent that it is insulting to you that one would even suggest that they are peer institutions.  ```
Is there a preference between the two colleges in the comment?
You MUST respond ```No preference``` if there is no explicit preference in the comment.
You MUST respond ```Has preference``` if there is explicit preference in the comment.

params.context_instruct:
You will be given two colleges A and B, and a comment. Your job is to identify the preference between the two given colleges in the comment. 
The names of the two colleges and the comment are delimited with triple backticks.

I will ask you the following questions one by one.
1. Is there a preference between the two colleges in the comment?
2. If there is a preference, what is the preference between the two colleges?

Here are the shared rules for both questions:
You MUST NOT use the colleges' real names.
You MUST refer to the colleges as A or B. 
You MUST NOT respond with any other response. 
You MUST NOT make up a preference when there is no preference in the comment.
